  16. (* Instruction scheduling *)

  18. open Reg
  19. open Mach
  20. open Linear

  22. (* Representation of the code DAG. *)

  24. ‌type code_dag_node =
  25.   { instr: instruction;                 (* The instruction *)
  26.     delay: int;           (* How many cycles before result is available *)
  27.     mutable sons: (code_dag_node * int) list;
  28.                                         (* Instructions that depend on it *)
  29.     mutable date: int;                  (* Start date *)
  30.     mutable length: int;                (* Length of longest path to result *)
  31.     mutable ancestors: int;             (* Number of ancestors *)
  32.     mutable emitted_ancestors: int }    (* Number of emitted ancestors *)

  34. ‌let dummy_node =
  35.   { instr = end_instr; delay = 0; sons = []; date = 0;
  36.     length = -1; ancestors = 0; emitted_ancestors = 0 }

  38. (* The code dag itself is represented by two tables from registers to nodes:
  39.    - "results" maps registers to the instructions that produced them;
  40.    - "uses" maps registers to the instructions that use them.
  41.    In addition:
  42.    - code_stores contains the latest store nodes emitted so far
  43.    - code_loads contains all load nodes emitted since the last store
  44.    - code_checkbounds contains the latest checkbound node not matched
  45.      by a subsequent load or store. *)

  47. let code_results = (Hashtbl.create 31 : (location, code_dag_node) Hashtbl.t)
  48. let code_uses = (Hashtbl.create 31 : (location, code_dag_node) Hashtbl.t)
  49. let code_stores = ref ([] : code_dag_node list)
  50. let code_loads = ref ([] : code_dag_node list)
  51. let code_checkbounds = ref ([] : code_dag_node list)

  53. let clear_code_dag () =
  54.   Hashtbl.clear code_results;
  55.   Hashtbl.clear code_uses;
  56.   code_stores := [];
  57.   code_loads := [];
  58.   code_checkbounds := []

  60. (* Add an edge to the code DAG *)

  62. let add_edge ancestor son delay =
  63.   ancestor.sons <- (son, delay) :: ancestor.sons;
  64.   son.ancestors <- son.ancestors + 1

  66. let add_edge_after son ancestor = add_edge ancestor son 0

  68. (* Add edges from all instructions that define a pseudoregister [arg] being used
  69.    as argument to node [node] (RAW dependencies *)

  71. let add_RAW_dependencies node arg =
  72.   try
  73.     let ancestor = Hashtbl.find code_results arg.loc in
  74.     add_edge ancestor node ancestor.delay
  75.   with Not_found ->
  76.     ()

  78. (* Add edges from all instructions that use a pseudoregister [res] that is
  79.    defined by node [node] (WAR dependencies). *)

  81. let add_WAR_dependencies node res =
  82.   let ancestors = Hashtbl.find_all code_uses res.loc in
  83.   List.iter (add_edge_after node) ancestors

  85. (* Add edges from all instructions that have already defined a pseudoregister
  86.    [res] that is defined by node [node] (WAW dependencies). *)

  88. let add_WAW_dependencies node res =
  89.   try
  90.     let ancestor = Hashtbl.find code_results res.loc in
  91.     add_edge ancestor node 0
  92.   with Not_found ->
  93.     ()

  95. (* Compute length of longest path to a result.
  96.    For leafs of the DAG, see whether their result is used in the instruction
  97.    immediately following the basic block (a "critical" output). *)

  99. let is_critical critical_outputs results =
  100.   try
  101.     for i = 0 to Array.length results - 1 do
  102.       let r = results.(i).loc in
  103.       for j = 0 to Array.length critical_outputs - 1 do
  104.         if critical_outputs.(j).loc = r then raise Exit
  105.       done
  106.     done;
  107.     false
  108.   with Exit ->
  109.     true

  111. let rec longest_path critical_outputs node =
  112.   if node.length < 0 then begin
  113.     match node.sons with
  114.       [] ->
  115.         node.length <-
  116.           if is_critical critical_outputs node.instr.res
  117.           || node.instr.desc = Lreloadretaddr (* always critical *)
  118.           then node.delay
  119.           else 0
  120.     | sons ->
  121.         node.length <-
  122.           List.fold_left
  123.             (fun len (son, delay) ->
  124.               Int.max len (longest_path critical_outputs son + delay))
  125.             0 sons
  126.   end;
  127.   node.length

  129. (* Remove an instruction from the ready queue *)

  131. ‌let rec remove_instr node = function
  132.     [] -> []
  133.   | instr :: rem ->
  134.       if instr == node then rem else instr :: remove_instr node rem

  136. (* We treat Lreloadretaddr as a word-sized load *)

  138. ‌let some_load =
  139.   Iload {
  140.     memory_chunk = Cmm.Word_int;
  141.     addressing_mode = Arch.identity_addressing;
  142.     mutability = Mutable;
  143.     is_atomic = false }

  145. (* The generic scheduler *)

  147. class virtual scheduler_generic = object (self)

  149. val mutable trywith_nesting = 0

  151. (* Determine whether an operation ends a basic block or not.
  152.    Can be overridden for some processors to signal specific instructions
  153.    that terminate a basic block. *)

  155. method oper_in_basic_block = function
  156.     Icall_ind -> false
  157.   | Icall_imm _ -> false
  158.   | Itailcall_ind -> false
  159.   | Itailcall_imm _ -> false
  160.   | Iextcall _ -> false
  161.   | Istackoffset _ -> false
  162.   | Ialloc _ | Ipoll _ -> false
  163.   | _ -> true

  165. (* Determine whether an instruction ends a basic block or not *)

  167. (* PR#2719: it is generally incorrect to schedule checkbound instructions
  168.    within a try ... with Invalid_argument _ -> ...
  169.    Hence, a checkbound instruction within a try...with block ends the
  170.    current basic block. *)

  172. method private instr_in_basic_block instr try_nesting =
  173.   match instr.desc with
  174.     Lop op ->
  175.       self#oper_in_basic_block op &&
  176.       not (try_nesting > 0 && self#is_checkbound op)
  177.   | Lreloadretaddr -> true
  178.   | _ -> false

  180. (* Determine whether an operation is a memory store or a memory load.
  181.    Can be overridden for some processors to signal specific
  182.    load or store instructions (e.g. on the I386). *)

  184. method is_store = function
  185.     Istore(_, _, _) -> true
  186.   | _ -> false

  188. method is_load = function
  189.     Iload _ -> true
  190.   | _ -> false

  192. method is_checkbound = function
  193.     Iintop(Icheckbound) -> true
  194.   | Iintop_imm(Icheckbound, _) -> true
  195.   | _ -> false

  197. method private instr_is_store instr =
  198.   match instr.desc with
  199.     Lop op -> self#is_store op
  200.   | _ -> false

  202. method private instr_is_load instr =
  203.   match instr.desc with
  204.     Lop op -> self#is_load op
  205.   | _ -> false

  207. method private instr_is_checkbound instr =
  208.   match instr.desc with
  209.     Lop op -> self#is_checkbound op
  210.   | _ -> false

  212. (* Estimate the latency of an operation. *)

  214. method virtual oper_latency : Mach.operation -> int

  216. (* Estimate the latency of a Lreloadretaddr operation. *)

  218. method reload_retaddr_latency = self#oper_latency some_load

  220. (* Estimate the delay needed to evaluate an instruction *)

  222. method private instr_latency instr =
  223.   match instr.desc with
  224.     Lop op -> self#oper_latency op
  225.   | Lreloadretaddr -> self#reload_retaddr_latency
  226.   | _ -> assert false

  228. (* Estimate the number of cycles consumed by emitting an operation. *)

  230. method virtual oper_issue_cycles : Mach.operation -> int

  232. (* Estimate the number of cycles consumed by emitting a Lreloadretaddr. *)

  234. method reload_retaddr_issue_cycles = self#oper_issue_cycles some_load

  236. (* Estimate the number of cycles consumed by emitting an instruction. *)

  238. method private instr_issue_cycles instr =
  239.   match instr.desc with
  240.     Lop op -> self#oper_issue_cycles op
  241.   | Lreloadretaddr -> self#reload_retaddr_issue_cycles
  242.   | _ -> assert false

  244. (* Pseudoregisters destroyed by an instruction *)

  246. method private destroyed_by_instr instr =
  247.   match instr.desc with
  248.   | Lop op -> Proc.destroyed_at_oper (Iop op)
  249.   | Lreloadretaddr -> [||]
  250.   | _ -> assert false

  252. (* Add an instruction to the code dag *)

  254. method private add_instruction ready_queue instr =
  255.   let delay = self#instr_latency instr in
  256.   let destroyed = self#destroyed_by_instr instr in
  257.   let node =
  258.     { instr = instr;
  259.       delay = delay;
  260.       sons = [];
  261.       date = 0;
  262.       length = -1;
  263.       ancestors = 0;
  264.       emitted_ancestors = 0 } in
  265.   (* Add edges from all instructions that define one of the registers used
  266.      (RAW dependencies) *)
  267.   Array.iter (add_RAW_dependencies node) instr.arg;
  268.   (* Also add edges from all instructions that use one of the result regs
  269.      of this instruction, or a reg destroyed by this instruction
  270.      (WAR dependencies). *)
  271.   Array.iter (add_WAR_dependencies node) instr.res;
  272.   Array.iter (add_WAR_dependencies node) destroyed;   (* PR#5731 *)
  273.   (* Also add edges from all instructions that have already defined one
  274.      of the results of this instruction, or a reg destroyed by
  275.      this instruction (WAW dependencies). *)
  276.   Array.iter (add_WAW_dependencies node) instr.res;
  277.   Array.iter (add_WAW_dependencies node) destroyed;   (* PR#5731 *)
  278.   (* If this is a load, add edges from the most recent store viewed so
  279.      far (if any) and remember the load.  Also add edges from the most
  280.      recent checkbound and forget that checkbound. *)
  281.   if self#instr_is_load instr then begin
  282.     List.iter (add_edge_after node) !code_stores;
  283.     code_loads := node :: !code_loads;
  284.     List.iter (add_edge_after node) !code_checkbounds;
  285.     code_checkbounds := []
  286.   end
  287.   (* If this is a store, add edges from the most recent store,
  288.      as well as all loads viewed since then, and also the most recent
  289.      checkbound. Remember the store,
  290.      discarding the previous stores, loads and checkbounds. *)
  291.   else if self#instr_is_store instr then begin
  292.     List.iter (add_edge_after node) !code_stores;
  293.     List.iter (add_edge_after node) !code_loads;
  294.     List.iter (add_edge_after node) !code_checkbounds;
  295.     code_stores := [node];
  296.     code_loads := [];
  297.     code_checkbounds := []
  298.   end
  299.   else if self#instr_is_checkbound instr then begin
  300.     code_checkbounds := [node]
  301.   end;
  302.   (* Remember the registers used and produced by this instruction *)
  303.   for i = 0 to Array.length instr.res - 1 do
  304.     Hashtbl.add code_results instr.res.(i).loc node
  305.   done;
  306.   for i = 0 to Array.length destroyed - 1 do
  307.     Hashtbl.add code_results destroyed.(i).loc node  (* PR#5731 *)
  308.   done;
  309.   for i = 0 to Array.length instr.arg - 1 do
  310.     Hashtbl.add code_uses instr.arg.(i).loc node
  311.   done;
  312.   (* If this is a root instruction (all arguments already computed),
  313.      add it to the ready queue *)
  314.   if node.ancestors = 0 then node :: ready_queue else ready_queue

  316. (* Given a list of instructions and a date, choose one or several
  317.    that are ready to be computed (start date <= current date)
  318.    and that we can emit in one cycle.  Favor instructions with
  319.    maximal distance to result.  If we can't find any, return None.
  320.    This does not take multiple issues into account, though. *)

  322. method private ready_instruction date queue =
  323.   let rec extract best = function
  324.     [] ->
  325.       if best == dummy_node then None else Some best
  326.   | instr :: rem ->
  327. ‌      let new_best =
  328.         if instr.date <= date && instr.length > best.length
  329.         then instr else best in
  330.       extract new_best rem in
  331.   extract dummy_node queue

  333. (* Schedule a basic block, adding its instructions in front of the given
  334.    instruction sequence *)

  336. method private reschedule ready_queue date cont =
  337.   if ready_queue = [] then cont else begin
  338.     match self#ready_instruction date ready_queue with
  339.       None ->
  340.         self#reschedule ready_queue (date + 1) cont
  341.     | Some node ->
  342.         (* Remove node from queue *)
  343.         let new_queue = ref (remove_instr node ready_queue) in
  344.         (* Update the start date and number of ancestors emitted of
  345.            all descendants of this node. Enter those that become ready
  346.            in the queue. *)
  347.         let issue_cycles = self#instr_issue_cycles node.instr in
  348.         List.iter
  349.           (fun (son, delay) ->
  350.             let completion_date = date + issue_cycles + delay - 1 in
  351.             if son.date < completion_date then son.date <- completion_date;
  352.             son.emitted_ancestors <- son.emitted_ancestors + 1;
  353.             if son.emitted_ancestors = son.ancestors then
  354.               new_queue := son :: !new_queue)
  355.           node.sons;
  356.         { node.instr with next =
  357.             self#reschedule !new_queue (date + issue_cycles) cont }
  358.   end

  360. (* Entry point *)
  361. (* Don't bother to schedule for initialization code and the like. *)

  363. method schedule_fundecl f =

  365.   let rec schedule i try_nesting =
  366.     match i.desc with
  367.     | Lend -> i
  368.     | Lpushtrap { lbl_handler = _; }
  369.       -> { i with next = schedule i.next (try_nesting + 1) }
  370.     | Lpoptrap -> { i with next = schedule i.next (try_nesting - 1) }
  371.     | _ ->
  372.         if self#instr_in_basic_block i try_nesting then begin
  373.           clear_code_dag();
  374.           schedule_block [] i try_nesting
  375.         end else
  376.           { i with next = schedule i.next try_nesting }

  378. ‌  and schedule_block ready_queue i try_nesting =
  379.     if self#instr_in_basic_block i try_nesting then
  380.       schedule_block (self#add_instruction ready_queue i) i.next try_nesting
  381.     else begin
  382.       let critical_outputs =
  383.         match i.desc with
  384.           Lop(Icall_ind | Itailcall_ind) -> [| i.arg.(0) |]
  385.         | Lop(Icall_imm _ | Itailcall_imm _ | Iextcall _) -> [||]
  386.         | Lreturn -> [||]
  387.         | _ -> i.arg in
  388.       List.iter (fun x -> ignore (longest_path critical_outputs x)) ready_queue;
  389.       self#reschedule ready_queue 0 (schedule i try_nesting)
  390.     end in

  392.   if f.fun_fast && !Clflags.insn_sched then begin
  393. ‌    let new_body = schedule f.fun_body 0 in
  394.     clear_code_dag();
  395.     { fun_name = f.fun_name;
  396.       fun_args = f.fun_args;
  397.       fun_body = new_body;
  398.       fun_fast = f.fun_fast;
  399.       fun_dbg  = f.fun_dbg;
  400.       fun_tailrec_entry_point_label = f.fun_tailrec_entry_point_label;
  401.       fun_contains_calls = f.fun_contains_calls;
  402.       fun_num_stack_slots = f.fun_num_stack_slots;
  403.       fun_frame_required = f.fun_frame_required;
  404.       fun_prologue_required = f.fun_prologue_required;
  405.     }
  406.   end else
  407.     f

  409. end

  411. ‌let reset () = clear_code_dag ()
